summary: I am a self-taught developer with four years of development experience in several languages and frameworks. After originally graduating from Stanford with a focus on energy and environmental engineering, I wanted to apply information technology to leverage efficiency and social connectedness to address the challenges of our burgeoning population and consumption.

I now primarily reside in Mexico City, though I return to San Francisco for several weeks annually. I am currently looking for additional projects to develop and manage through my development company.

I am a full stack developer with particular expertise in RESTful API services for web and mobile applications. I have substantial front end experience in developing user interactive forms and graphics. My Android experience is developing and I hope to release new apps in the coming months.
Fullstack developer for Oroeco.com – a platform that estimates personal carbon footprints based on survey and financial data.
list: Carbon footprint calculations based off of survey data.
Dynamic user interface for survey input.
Carbon footprint calculations based off of Green Button utility data (a DOE XML standard).
Dynamic graphics for visualizing electricity consumption.
API development for Oroeco mobile apps.
Implementation of Social Media features (Facebook, Twitter, Google, LinkedIn API)

summary: Developer and content curator for Climateworks intranet for global network of grantees and partner organizations. Development of API's of climate data and funding. Rendering data with interactive user graphics (SVG, Javascript, RaphaelJs). Worked closely with network leaders to identify their need to visualize and share where climate philanthropy is most effectively applied using data from Bloomberg.
Developed a payments API through Amazon AWS for a startup 3D printing company. Built a Heroku proxy using NodeJs in order to securely make payments.
I lead a Javascript programming workshop at a workspace in the Obrera neighborhood of Mexico City.
Fundraising and management of a computer project to support a water project in Arombe, Kenya.
Tutored and assistant taught high schools students at the Drew School for two years after completing my Masters program. Subjects included Spanish, Math, and Science.
Grant writer for Samasource, a San Francisco non-profit that connects low income communities in India and Kenya with economic opportunities in the tech sector.
Open source project using Reegle clean energy linked open data api. Users can save search criteria and a list of favorite documents.
Worked with DOE to develop a Ruby parser for the GreenButton utility energy data standard.
Javascript SVG charting library using RaphaelJs. Includes high variable pie and bar charts.
Graduated with honors first year of Stanford's Atmosphere and Energy program.
After graduating with an engineering degree, I took some time to focus on my writing and communication skills, as well as my personal interest in US foreign policy history.
I definitely enjoy Javascript because of its diversity of programming environments - client, server, and now mobile.
I'm most fluid in Angular, Node, and web client Javascript, but I pretty quickly adapt to new libraries.
I would really like to work on developing open data and applications for evaluating products and services in terms of their environmental impact.
We have used the Berkeley Cool Climate Network carbon calculator API extensively at Oroeco, which rests on input-output life cycle data analysis.
I've only done a month long open source project in Android, but am looking to expand here.
My first programming language. Now using it to write investment algorthms at Quantopian.com.
